list.name: Default
list.comment:
Commiting compiled binaries now aswell.
Since there could be trouble with compiling the new Scala code, I am going to provide direct binaries now aswell. The program can be launched using the following commands in the (windows, not git!)-console:
cd Pfeile/src java general.Main

task.summary:
Commiting compiled binaries now aswell.
Since there could be trouble with compiling the new Scala code, I am going to provide direct binaries now aswell. The program can be launched using the following commands in the (windows, not git!)-console:
cd Pfeile/src java general.Main

Third huge update!
Tiles are being displayed now in isometric view. The default world size is 45x45 for the time being. A new (temporary) screen class has been created for testing the new world API. If you want to switch back to the old game screen, simply go to the method "initializeScreens()" in GameWindow and do the necessary changes. A rudimentary implementation of the new entity API is provided under the new package "entity".
The map can be moved with the arrow keys; an ability to zoom is provided with the PageUp and PageDown key. The performance of the new tile system is, especially at the drawing, at an all-time low. The point is: in class Tile is no "updateGUI()" method yet. So the coordinates are recalculated at every drawing process. The tile is not compatible with the "Component" superclass yet, but it will soon, as I go fix all bugs in the new tile system.

Fixed mouse listener bug.
The bug would make the "mouseEntered()" method of the listener in the component execute even if the mouse is already inside of the component.

MESSAGE.value:
Commiting compiled binaries now aswell.
Since there could be trouble with compiling the new Scala code, I am going to provide direct binaries now aswell. The program can be launched using the following commands in the (windows, not git!)-console:
cd Pfeile/src java general.Main

Third huge update!
Tiles are being displayed now in isometric view. The default world size is 45x45 for the time being. A new (temporary) screen class has been created for testing the new world API. If you want to switch back to the old game screen, simply go to the method "initializeScreens()" in GameWindow and do the necessary changes. A rudimentary implementation of the new entity API is provided under the new package "entity".
The map can be moved with the arrow keys; an ability to zoom is provided with the PageUp and PageDown key. The performance of the new tile system is, especially at the drawing, at an all-time low. The point is: in class Tile is no "updateGUI()" method yet. So the coordinates are recalculated at every drawing process. The tile is not compatible with the "Component" superclass yet, but it will soon, as I go fix all bugs in the new tile system.

Fixed mouse listener bug.
The bug would make the "mouseEntered()" method of the listener in the component execute even if the mouse is already inside of the component.

option.name: LAST_COMMIT_MESSAGE
option.value:
Fixed mouse listener bug.
The bug would make the "mouseEntered()" method of the listener in the component execute even if the mouse is already inside of the component.
